title: Federal Grand Jury Indicts Former Boeing Pilot in 737 MAX Crash Case
sub_head: Former Boeing 737 chief technical pilot Mark Forkner charged with deceiving Federal Aviation Administration
body:
A federal grand jury in Texas indicted a former Boeing Co. pilot for allegedly deceiving federal regulators during the plane makerâ€™s development of the 737 MAX before two of the jets crashed, the U.S. Department of Justice said.
Mark A. Forkner, 49 years old, was charged with deceiving the Federal Aviation Administration regarding training materials related to a flight-control system that was later blamed for playing a large role the crashes, the Justice Department said. The crashes occurred in late 2018 and early 2019 and took 346 lives.
